title: Mobile-first Tutor LMS course menu (no login)

requirements.summary: Build a mobile-first responsive course menu app that opens Tutor LMS course links with no login/auth UI.
acceptanceCriteria: App renders correctly on small screens (phone width) and desktop screens.
No login UI is present; users can access the course list immediately on load.
Each course in the menu has a clear action that opens the course content (e.g., open in a new tab or in-app view).

file_operations.description: Create the main application shell with mobile-first layout (header + hero illustration + content), and render the course list immediately on load (no authentication UX). Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Card, Button, Input) to provide consistent UI primitives; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add a reusable responsive shell (max-width container, sticky header on mobile, spacing) used across list/detail/settings sections. Use shadcn-ui components where appropriate (e.g., Separator); verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a tappable, accessible course card optimized for small screens, with a clear primary action to open the Tutor LMS URL (new tab). Use shadcn-ui Card and Button to standardize interaction styling; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire the generated app icon as the favicon/app icon reference using frontend/public/assets/generated/app-icon.dim_512x512.png (and keep the existing responsive viewport meta).
Add the generated asset file for the app icon so it can be referenced by the UI and HTML head.
Add the generated hero illustration asset file so it can be rendered in the app header/hero area.

requirements.summary: Provide a course data source with manual defaults plus an optional remote JSON feed, and a settings UI to switch modes with safe manual default and robust error handling.
acceptanceCriteria: Manual course list works out-of-the-box without requiring any external endpoint.
When a remote JSON feed URL is provided, the app attempts to fetch and render courses from that URL.
If remote fetch fails (network/CORS/invalid JSON), the UI shows a clear error state and allows returning to the manual list.

file_operations.description: Define frontend-only course and data-source types (manual vs remote), including required fields (title, short description, optional thumbnail URL, course URL).
Provide a safe default manual course list configuration (English labels/content) that works out-of-the-box without any remote feed.

Implement the course loading logic to either return the manual list or attempt a remote JSON fetch (with validation and error mapping for network/CORS/invalid JSON), without assuming a specific Tutor LMS format beyond the configured fields.

Create a simple settings area that lets the user switch between 'Manual list' and 'Remote JSON feed' and enter a feed URL, with a clear error state and a one-click way to revert to the manual list. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Tabs or RadioGroup, Input, Alert) to provide consistent controls; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Wire the settings panel into the app (e.g., via a Settings button in the header) and connect it to the course loading logic so switching modes updates the visible course list. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Dialog/Sheet for mobile-friendly settings) as needed; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add course browsing UX with title search, optional list/grid toggle, and a course detail view with a prominent 'Open course' action.
acceptanceCriteria: User can filter the visible course list using a text search input.
Clicking a course opens a detail view with at least title and an 'Open course' action.
The 'Open course' action navigates to the configured Tutor LMS course URL reliably.

file_operations.description: Add a search input that filters courses by title (case-insensitive) and is optimized for mobile entry. Use shadcn-ui Input for consistent styling; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add an optional list/grid toggle control for browsing courses. Use shadcn-ui Toggle/ToggleGroup or Segmented control equivalent; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Render the filtered course collection in either list or grid mode, with touch-friendly spacing and thumbnails when provided; clicking a course opens the detail view.

Create a course detail view showing title, description, optional thumbnail, and a prominent 'Open course' button that opens the configured Tutor LMS URL reliably (e.g., new tab). Use shadcn-ui Card and Button for consistent hierarchy; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire search, list/grid toggle, and navigation between list and detail views (in-app view state), ensuring mobile-friendly back navigation and no new top-level routes are required.

requirements.summary: Apply a cohesive warm education-themed visual design with consistent typography/spacing and a non-blue/non-purple primary palette.
acceptanceCriteria: UI has a consistent theme across course list, course detail, and settings.
Primary color palette is not blue/purple.
Typography and spacing feel intentionally designed rather than default browser styles.

file_operations.description: Define global styles and Tailwind CSS variables for a warm palette (e.g., amber/terracotta/neutral) and consistent typography/spacing, ensuring the primary color is not blue/purple. Keep styling centralized in this global entry point.

Adjust theme defaults as needed to support the warm education theme (e.g., radius, shadows, and mapping to CSS variables) while keeping the palette non-blue/non-purple and consistent across components.
Apply consistent header/content spacing and render the hero illustration from frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-illustration.dim_1200x400.png in a responsive way appropriate for mobile/desktop.

requirements.summary: Persist the selected data source mode and remote feed URL locally so they survive reloads and are applied automatically.
acceptanceCriteria: After refresh, the app retains the previously selected data source mode.
If a remote feed URL was entered, it is restored on reload and used again (unless user switches back to manual).

file_operations.description: Implement a small localStorage-backed persistence utility for the data source mode and remote feed URL (with safe defaults and basic validation).
Create a React hook that loads persisted settings on startup and updates storage when the user changes mode or feed URL.
Wire persisted settings into app startup and course loading so the previously selected mode and URL are restored and used automatically, with a safe fallback to manual list.

Bind settings controls to persisted state (mode + URL), and ensure the UI can recover cleanly by switching back to manual mode if remote fetch fails. Use shadcn-ui form controls consistently; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
